00001 /**
00002  * @file queue.c
00003  *
00004  * @date 2009-04-24
00005  * @author: Jean-Lou Dupont
00006  *
00007  *
00008  * The _queue_ module isn't aware of its elements
00009  * and thus it is the responsibility of the clients
00010  * to properly dispose of the _nodes_ once retrieved.
00011  *
00012  * The term ``node`` is used generically to refer
00013  * to a node element inside a queue.
00014  *
00015  */
00016 
00017 #include <pthread.h>
00018 #include <errno.h>
00019 
00020 #include "logger.h"
00021 #include "litm.h"
00022 #include "queue.h"
00023 
00024 void *__queue_get_safe(queue *q);

00027 /**
00028  * Creates a queue
00029  */
00030 queue *queue_create(int id) {
00031 
00032         pthread_mutex_t *cond_mutex = malloc( sizeof(pthread_mutex_t) );
00033         if (NULL==cond_mutex) {
00034                 return NULL;
00035         }
00036 
00037         pthread_cond_t *cond = malloc( sizeof (pthread_cond_t) );
00038         if (NULL == cond) {
00039                 return NULL;
00040         }
00041 
00042         // if this malloc fails,
00043         //  there are much bigger problems that loom
00044         pthread_mutex_t *mutex = malloc( sizeof(pthread_mutex_t) );
00045         queue *q = malloc( sizeof(queue) );
00046 
00047         if ((NULL != q) && (NULL != mutex)){
00048 
00049                 q->head  = NULL;
00050                 q->tail  = NULL;
00051                 q->num   = 0;
00052                 q->id    = id;
00053                 q->total_in  = 0;
00054                 q->total_out = 0;
00055 
00056                 pthread_mutex_init( mutex, NULL );
00057                 pthread_mutex_init( cond_mutex, NULL );
00058                 pthread_cond_init( cond, NULL );
00059 
00060                 q->mutex      = mutex;
00061                 q->cond_mutex = cond_mutex;
00062                 q->cond       = cond;
00063 
00064         } else {
00065 
00066                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_create: MALLOC ERROR");
00067 
00068                 if (NULL!=q)
00069                         free(q);
00070 
00071                 if (NULL!=mutex)
00072                         pthread_mutex_destroy(mutex);
00073 
00074                 if (NULL!=cond_mutex)
00075                         pthread_mutex_destroy(cond_mutex);
00076         }
00077 
00078         return q;
00079 }// init
00080 
00081 /**
00082  * Destroys a queue
00083  *
00084  * This function is **not** aware of the
00085  *  message(s) potentially inside the queue,
00086  *  thus, the queue must be drained **before**
00087  *  using this function.
00088  *
00089  * The queue can be drained by:
00090  * - stopping the thread that ``puts``
00091  * - ``getting`` until NULL is returned
00092  *
00093  */
00094 void queue_destroy(queue *q) {
00095 
00096         if (NULL==q) {
00097 
00098                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_destroy: NULL queue ptr");
00099                 return;
00100         }
00101         pthread_mutex_t *mutex = q->mutex;
00102         pthread_mutex_t *cond_mutex = q->cond_mutex;
00103         pthread_cond_t  *cond  = q->cond;
00104 
00105         pthread_mutex_lock( mutex );
00106                 free(q);
00107                 q=NULL;
00108         pthread_mutex_unlock( mutex );
00109 
00110         pthread_mutex_destroy(mutex);
00111         pthread_mutex_destroy(cond_mutex);
00112         pthread_cond_destroy(cond);
00113 
00114 }//
00115 
00116 /**
00117  * Queues a node at the HEAD (non-blocking)
00118  *
00119  * @return 1  => success
00120  * @return 0  => error
00121  * @return -1 => busy
00122  *
00123  */
00124         int
00125 queue_put_head_nb(queue *q, void *node) {
00126 
00127         if ((NULL==q) || (NULL==node)) {
00128                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_put_head_nb: NULL queue/node ptr");
00129                 return 0;
00130         }
00131 
00132         if (EBUSY == pthread_mutex_trylock( q->mutex ))
00133                 return -1;
00134 
00135                 int returnCode = queue_put_head_safe( q, node );
00136 
00137         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00138 
00139         return returnCode;
00140 }//[/queue_put]
00141 
00142 /**
00143  * Puts a node at the HEAD of the queue
00144  *
00145  * This function is meant to support _high priority_ messages.
00146  *
00147  * @param q      queue reference
00148  * @param node   message reference
00149  *
00150  * @return 1 => success
00151  * @return 0 => error
00152  *
00153  */
00154 int   queue_put_head(queue *q, void *node) {
00155 
00156         if ((NULL==q) || (NULL==node)) {
00157                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_put_head: NULL queue/node ptr");
00158                 return 0;
00159         }
00160 
00161         int code;
00162 
00163         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00164 
00165                 code = queue_put_head_safe( q, node );
00166 
00167         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00168 
00169         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_put: END");
00170 
00171         return code;
00172 
00173 }//
00174 
00175 /**
00176  * Puts a node a the HEAD of the queue
00177  * without regards to thread-safety
00178  *
00179  */
00180         int
00181 queue_put_head_safe( queue *q, void *msg ) {
00182 
00183         int code = 1;
00184         queue_node *tmp=NULL;
00185 
00186         // if this malloc fails,
00187         //  there are much bigger problems that loom
00188         tmp = (queue_node *) malloc(sizeof(queue_node));
00189         if (NULL!=tmp) {
00190 
00191                 tmp->node = msg;
00192                 tmp->next = NULL;
00193 
00194                 // there is a head... put at the front
00195                 if (NULL!=q->head) {
00196                         tmp->next = q->head;
00197                 }
00198 
00199                 // adjust head
00200                 q->head = tmp;
00201 
00202                 // adjust tail
00203                 if (NULL==q->tail)
00204                         q->tail=tmp;
00205 
00206                 // we were able to put an element:
00207                 //  signal the waiting thread(s)
00208                 //pthread_cond_signal( q->cond );
00209 
00210                 q->num++;
00211 
00212         } else {
00213 
00214                 code = 0;
00215         }
00216 
00217         return code;
00218 }//
00219

00221 /**
00222  * Queues a node (blocking)
00223  *
00224  * @return 1 => success
00225  * @return 0 => error
00226  *
00227   */
00228 int queue_put(queue *q, void *node) {
00229 
00230         if ((NULL==q) || (NULL==node)) {
00231                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_put: NULL queue/node ptr");
00232                 return 0;
00233         }
00234 
00235         int code;
00236 
00237         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_put: q[%x] node[%x] BEGIN",q, node);
00238         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00239 
00240                 code = queue_put_safe( q, node );
00241 
00242         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00243         if (code)
00244                 pthread_cond_signal( q->cond );
00245 
00246         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_put: q[%x] node[%x] END",q,node);
00247 
00248         return code;
00249 }//[/queue_put]

00253 /**
00254  * Queues a node (non-blocking)
00255  *
00256  * @return 1  => success
00257  * @return 0  => error
00258  * @return -1 => busy
00259  *
00260  */
00261 int queue_put_nb(queue *q, void *node) {
00262 
00263         if ((NULL==q) || (NULL==node)) {
00264                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_put_nb: NULL queue/node ptr");
00265                 return 0;
00266         }
00267 
00268         if (EBUSY == pthread_mutex_trylock( q->mutex ))
00269                 return -1;
00270 
00271                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_put_nb: q[%x] node[%x] BEGIN",q, node);
00272                 int code = queue_put_safe( q, node );
00273 
00274         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00275         if (code)
00276                 pthread_cond_signal( q->cond );
00277 
00278         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_put_nb: q[%x] node[%x] END",q, node);
00279 
00280         return code;
00281 }//[/queue_put]

00283 
00284 void queue_signal(queue *q) {
00285         int rc = pthread_cond_signal( q->cond );
00286         if (rc)
00287                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_signal: SIGNAL ERROR");
00288 }
00289 
00290 
00291 /**
00292  * Queue_put_safe
00293  *
00294  * Lock is not handled here - the caller must take
00295  * care of this.
00296  *
00297  * @return 0 => error
00298  * @return 1 => success
00299  *
00300  */
00301         int
00302 queue_put_safe( queue *q, void *node ) {
00303 
00304         int code = 1;
00305         queue_node *new_node=NULL;
00306 
00307         // if this malloc fails,
00308         //  there are much bigger problems that loom
00309         new_node = (queue_node *) malloc(sizeof(queue_node));
00310         if (NULL!=new_node) {
00311 
00312                 // new node...
00313                 new_node->node = node;
00314                 new_node->next = NULL;
00315 
00316                 // there is a tail... put at the end
00317                 if (NULL!=q->tail)
00318                         (q->tail)->next=new_node;
00319 
00320                 // point tail to the new element
00321                 q->tail = new_node;
00322 
00323                 // adjust head
00324                 if (NULL==q->head)
00325                         q->head=new_node;
00326 
00327                 q->total_in++;
00328                 q->num++;
00329                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_put_safe: q[%x] id[%i] num[%i] in[%i] out[%i]", q, q->id, q->num, q->total_in, q->total_out);
00330 
00331                 // we were able to put an element:
00332                 //  signal the waiting thread(s)
00333                 //int rc=pthread_cond_signal( q->cond );
00334                 //if (rc) {
00335                 //      DEBUG_LOG(LOG_ERR,"queue_put_safe: ERROR during COND_SIGNAL");
00336                 //}
00337 
00338         } else {
00339 
00340                 code = 0;
00341         }
00342 
00343         return code;
00344 }//

00347 /**
00348  * Retrieves the next node from a queue
00349  *
00350  * @return NULL if none.
00351  *
00352  */
00353 void *queue_get(queue *q) {
00354 
00355         if (NULL==q) {
00356                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_get: NULL queue ptr");
00357                 return NULL;
00358         }
00359 
00360         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00361 
00362                 void *node=NULL;
00363                 node = __queue_get_safe(q);
00364 
00365         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00366 
00367         return node;
00368 }//[/queue_get]
00369 
00370 /**
00371  * Retrieves the next node from a queue (non-blocking)
00372  *
00373  * @return NULL => No node OR BUSY
00374  *
00375  */
00376 void *queue_get_nb(queue *q) {
00377 
00378         if (NULL==q) {
00379                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_get_nb: NULL queue ptr");
00380                 return NULL;
00381         }
00382 
00383         if (EBUSY==pthread_mutex_trylock( q->mutex )) {
00384                 return NULL;
00385         }
00386 
00387                 void *node=NULL;
00388                 node = __queue_get_safe(q);
00389 
00390         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00391 
00392         return node;
00393 }//[/queue_get]

00396 /**
00397  * Waits for a node in the queue
00398  *
00399  * @return 0 SUCCESS
00400  * @return 1 FAILURE
00401  *
00402  */
00403 int queue_wait(queue *q) {
00404 
00405         if (NULL==q) {
00406                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_get_wait: NULL queue ptr");
00407                 return 1;
00408         }
00409 
00410         pthread_mutex_lock( q->cond_mutex );
00411 
00412                 // it seems we need to wait...
00413                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_get_wait: waiting on q[%x][%i]",q,q->id);
00414                 int rc = pthread_cond_wait( q->cond, q->cond_mutex );
00415 
00416                 //int result2 = pthread_mutex_trylock( q->mutex );
00417                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_get_wait: TRYLOCK q[%x][%i] result[%i] ",q,q->id,result2==EBUSY);
00418 
00419                 if (rc) {
00420                         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_ERR,"queue_get_wait: CONDITION WAIT ERROR");
00421                 }
00422 
00423         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->cond_mutex );
00424 
00425         return rc;
00426 }//
00427 
00428 void *__queue_get_safe(queue *q) {
00429 
00430         queue_node *tmp = NULL;
00431         void *node=NULL;
00432 
00433         tmp = q->head;
00434         if (tmp!=NULL) {
00435 
00436                 // the queue contained at least one node
00437                 node = tmp->node;
00438 
00439                 // adjust tail: case if tail==head
00440                 //  ie. only one element present
00441                 if (q->head == q->tail) {
00442                         q->tail = NULL;
00443                         q->head = NULL;
00444                 } else {
00445                         // adjust head : next pointer is already set
00446                         //  to NULL in queue_put
00447                         q->head = (q->head)->next;
00448                 }
00449 
00450                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_get: MESSAGE PRESENT, freeing queue_node[%x]", tmp);
00451                 free(tmp);
00452 
00453                 q->total_out++;
00454                 q->num--;
00455 
00456                 //{
00457                 int count=0, in=q->total_in, out=q->total_out;
00458                 tmp = q->head;
00459                 while(tmp) {
00460                         count++;
00461                         tmp = tmp->next;
00462                 }
00463                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"QQQ: q[%x] id[%3i] num[%3i] in[%4i] out[%4i] COUNT[%4i]", q, q->id, q->num, q->total_in, q->total_out, count);
00464                 if ((in-out) != count) {
00465                         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_ERR, "QQQ: >>> ERROR <<<");
00466                 }
00467                 //}
00468 
00469         }
00470 
00471         return node;
00472 }//
00473 
00474 /**
00475  * Verifies if a message is present
00476  *
00477  * @return 1 if at least 1 message is present,
00478  * @return 0  if NONE
00479  * @return -1 on ERROR
00480  *
00481  */
00482 int queue_peek(queue *q) {
00483 
00484         if (NULL==q) {
00485                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "queue_peek: NULL queue ptr");
00486                 return -1;
00487         }
00488 
00489         queue_node *tmp = NULL;
00490         int result = 0;
00491 
00492         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00493 
00494                 tmp = q->head;
00495                 result = (tmp!=NULL);
00496 
00497         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00498 
00499         return result;
00500 } // queue_peek
